entry.title: Last chances and second glances
entry.summary:
Author: thebookofcrows

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 149,830Chapters: 44/60Kudos: 831

Summary: St. Anthony‚Äôs was his last chance, and Evan knew that. He had been kicked out of five schools in the past six years, and after his sophomore year ended with a meeting between his parents and his last headmaster that could be summarized with: ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not kicking him out, but just know that Evan is not welcome back in September.‚Äù His parents wanted to send him to military school. ¬† ¬† ¬† Evan knew he couldn‚Äôt survive military school, that would be his last drop, the one that finally shattered the vase. He couldn‚Äôt be the type of person that would be able to put himself back together once they broke him down. ¬† ¬† This had to work. . . . Buck is the new kid in an El Paso boarding school, trying his best to stay out of trouble. Eddie is a rockstar (in the world of high school popularity) he's captain to the football team, he's dating the most popular girl in school, and looking at a full ride sports scholarship in the fall. He should feel like he won at life, which is why he doesn't understand why the only time he feels alive is when he catches a glimpse of the new guy on the running team. Or in simpler terms: Buddie high-school AU!

Author: wordsmithofsortz

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,378Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 18

"Hey you've reached Buck the superhero genius, leave your message at the beep....BEEP" "Hey, just calling to check in. Your probably busy with something, or napping, or maybe your ignoring me. God I'm rambling aren't I."

entry.title: i'ma strike these matches
entry.summary:
Author: sinnabonka

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,818Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 66

Summary: They drive, and the world flies by in a smear of green and blue, then yellow and pink, then purple and black. Between nodding off, texting Chris, and staring through the side window, Eddie finds himself thinking about what his life has become. Little pockets of time where everything is normal, when he and Buck can look one another in the eyes and have a conversation ‚Äì usually surrounded by other people, though, so those conversations never get a chance to dip into something serious, something that matters. Always with a buffer, a witness, chaperoned in their inability to exist in the shared space without actively breaking something.or Forced into a hundred and thirty cubic feet of space for a thirty-hour drive ‚Äì something‚Äôs gotta give.

entry.title: highway to hell (and back)
entry.summary:
Author: madforyou

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,178Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 143

Summary: "Leave it," Eddie says, his voice pulled taut like a wire about to snap, tight enough to hum. Buck looks at him, and Eddie‚Äôs whole body has gone so rigid he looks carved from stone, but Buck will ruminate on that later. But he can't exactly leave his phone under the seat for the next eight hundred miles, it's got his whole life on it, every stupid photo he's ever taken of Christopher and Eddie and Eddie and Christopher and, embarrassingly, just Eddie, so many just-Eddies, an entire hidden album of candids he'll never admit to because they constitute evidence of something he's been pretending he doesn't feel. "I can't leave it, it's my phone. It's got‚Äî hold on, I think it slid under your seat." ‚ÄúBuck, don‚Äôt.‚Äù It‚Äôs as if Eddie doesn‚Äôt even know him, because Buck has never once heard the word don‚Äôt and responded with anything resembling obedience. So now he‚Äôs stretching across the center console with one hand braced on Eddie‚Äôs thigh for leverage, the other reaching blindly into the dark gap beneath the driver‚Äôs seat, and he‚Äôs aware on some level that his positioning is‚Äî that he‚Äôs essentially‚Äî that his head is‚Äî He‚Äôs in Eddie‚Äôs lap. Or,What's a little road-head between friends?

entry.title: Cloudchaser
entry.summary:
Author: TheGreenestBean

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,070Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 40

Summary: Once they were settled Evan looked over only to be greeted by the most gorgeous man he had ever seen in his life. They made eye contact and the man smiled at him, showing off perfect teeth and expressive brown eyes, the olive green of his jacket making them pop. His arms were lazily draped over the bar, poles in hand. ‚ÄúHey.‚Äù The man said. ‚ÄúHey.‚Äù Evan replied. ‚ÄúWell, looks like you‚Äôre stuck with me for the next ten minutes Evan, sorry to crash your solo ride.‚Äù ‚ÄúH-how do you know my name?‚Äù He asked, feeling very flustered. The man chuckled, his eyes crinkling with it, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre wearing a name badge.‚Äù He reminded him. Shit, of course, his name badge, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm Eddie, in case you were wondering.‚Äù or After leaving home Buck moves to the mountains and begins a new life in the snow, only to meet a cute skier on a broken down chairlift. Years later they meet again, this time at a fire station in LA.

Author: CakeAnyoneAnyone28

Summary: Buck and Tommy have been steady ever since that kiss after the basketball game. It‚Äôs good. It‚Äôs easy. Tommy wants him in a way that feels safe. Buck tells himself that‚Äôs enough. He‚Äôs finally accepted that he likes men so dating Tommy makes sense, right? It‚Äôs real. It‚Äôs tangible. It isn‚Äôt the impossible thing he‚Äôs been carrying for years. Because Eddie is straight. Eddie is his best friend. And Buck knows better than to want something he can‚Äôt have. So he chooses Tommy. But what happens when the truth slips out in his sleep‚Ä¶ and the name on his lips isn‚Äôt Tommy‚Äôs?

Summary: Chim scoffs. "Eddie, he was just cutting your meatballs for you." "He likes them cut," Buck says with a frown. "But," Ravi starts, looking around the room like this is some elaborate prank being pulled on him. "He could cut them himself." "But he was giving me the crust of my garlic bread." "Again, something you could've done yourself." "But he was giving me my ice," Eddie says with a frown to match Buck's. "What's the issue?" or, Eddie doesn't like lasagna

Summary: He realizes it right before everything goes to shit. He‚Äôs just standing there in the loft and Eddie‚Äôs handing him Christopher‚Äôs backpack and talking about ‚Äúhe‚Äôs not that fast‚Äù and ‚Äúorder pizza‚Äù and Buck sort of stares at him‚Äîpartly in shock, partly in reverence‚Äîand he thinks "I love you." He shoves it down immediately, of course, as far down as it‚Äôll go, but the fact of the matter is, it‚Äôs there somewhere, floating around inside of him. He can‚Äôt get rid of it now. Not that it matters all that much, though, because there‚Äôs the whole quitting thing and the lawsuit thing and the argument in the grocery store and by the time he‚Äôs given his (re)start date he know; he well and truly fucked up. ¬†or: another classic post-lawsuit fic. entry.title: we're riding out tonight to case the promised land
entry.summary:
Author: dante_kent

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,067Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 71

Summary: Here, in this little rental car, no one but the two of them around for miles and miles‚Ä¶he felt hyperaware of himself, the sound of his breathing, every shift of his legs against the leather of the seat. Aware of Buck too, the heat of his body radiating towards him in the close space, a rival to the blaze of the sun beating down on him through the windshield. It all stirred something frenetic in Eddie, setting him on edge. ~ Buck and Eddie take an impromptu road trip from Nashville to LA. What's 2,000 miles and a shared bed between friends?
